summary: Returns a list of product performance metrics
description:
Returns a list of product performance metrics. This API currently provides data only for shops registered in the United States, United Kingdom, Singapore, Vietnam, and Thailand.​ Version
202405
  
API Testing Tool
​

query.description: Use this property to pass shop information in requesting the API. Failure in passing the correct value when requesting the API for cross-border shops will return incorrect response. ​ Get by API Get Authorization Shop​
Every single app will have a unique key. Please use the specific key assigned to your app.​
Signature generated by gen algorithm. When you send API requests to TTS, you must sign them so that TTS can identify the senders. ​
Unix timestamp GMT (UTC+00:00). This timestamp is used across all API requests. Developers can use this convert to local time.​
Start date (ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DD format) in shop registered timezone.​ In the parameter name, "ge" refers to "greater than or equal to" (inclusive)​
End date (ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DD format) in shop registered timezone.​ In the parameter name, "lt" refers to "less than" (exclusive)​
Number of products per page.​ Max value: 100​ Default value: 10​
Sort on.​ Available values: gmv, order_count, unit_sold_count, click_through_rate​ Default value: gmv​
Sort direction.​ Available values: ASC, DESC​ Default value: DESC​ * ASC: ascending​ * DESC: descending​
Currency.​ Available values: USD, LOCAL​ Default value: LOCAL​ * USD: US dollars​ * LOCAL: local currency where the shop is located​
Page token, indicating the current position. Used for requesting next page data.​ Leave this field empty for first time queries.​

header.description: The seller access_token value from Get Access Token, when user_type = 0. Follow this guide to get seller access_token.​

schema.description: The success or failure status code returned in API response.​
The success or failure messages returned in API response. Reasons of failure will be described in the message.​

children.description: Overall Gross Merchandise Value (GMV) for the product.​
GMV amount in the corresponding currency.​
GMV currency code (ISO 4217 standard). If LOCAL currency is requested, the value will be the local currency code of where the shop is registered (e.g. GBP).​
Total (sum of all) orders for the product.​
Number of units sold for the product.​
Ratio of the number of product clicks compared to number of product impressions in raw decimal format. To calculate the percentage, multiple it by 100%.​ Example: 0.0528 <=> 5.28%​
Page token for the next page request.​
Latest date in local timezone where data is ready (ISO 8601 format).​
